contentrichtext.text: [[File:Knut Frydenlung.jpg|thumb|Knut Frydenlung]] '''Knut Frydenlund''' (March 31, 1927–February 26, 1987) was a [[Norway|Norwegian]] diplomat. His most significant achievement was as [[Foreign minister of Norway|Norwegian foreign minister]] between 1973 and 1981, and again between 1986 and 1987. Frydenlund was born in [[Drammen]] and began his diplomatic career in the 1950s, initially serving at the Norwegian embassy in [[Bonn]], and served in various diplomatic positions during the '50s and the 1960s. In 1969 he was elected to parliament as a member of the [[Norwegian Labour Party]], and he became foreign minister in the Labour government in 1973. While Labour was out of power from 1981 to 1986, he was replaced as foreign minister by [[Svenn Thorkild Stray]], but returned to the office in May 1986. In February 1987, following his return from a [[Nordic Council]] meeting in [[Helsinki]], he collapsed at [[Oslo]]'s [[Oslo Airport, Fornebu|Fornebu Airport]] due to a [[cerebral hemorrhage]] and died soon afterwards at Ullevaal Hospital in Oslo. ==References== *[[Associated Press]], "Norway's Foreign Minister Dies", February 26, 1987. {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box | before=[[Svenn Stray]]| title=[[Minister of Foreign Affairs]] | years=1986–1987| after=[[Thorvald Stoltenberg]]}} {{succession box | before=[[Dagfinn VÃ¥rvik]]| title=[[Minister of Foreign Affairs]] | years=1973–1981| after=[[Svenn Stray]]}} {{s-end}} {{Foreigner Minister of Norway}} {{Authority control|VIAF=3811265}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Frydenlund, Knut | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Norwegian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1927 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1987 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Frydenlund, Knut}} [[Category:1927 births]] [[Category:1987 deaths]] [[Category:People from Drammen]] [[Category:Norwegian diplomats]] [[Category:Foreign Ministers of Norway]] [[Category:Labour Party (Norway) politicians]] [[Category:Members of the Parliament of Norway]]
